tagline: Blind text generator with tons of configuration options
body:
# Lorem Ipsum Amet ## Blind text generator ### Installation With gemfile Add this to your gemfile: `gem 'lorem_ipsum_amet'` And run `bundle install` Without gemfile In your shell `gem install 'lorem_ipsum_amet'` And then in your ruby code `require 'lorem_ipsum_amet'` ### Usage `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum` - default Lorem Ipsum text `LoremIpsum.text` - alias for #lorem_ipsum `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum(50)` - 50 characters `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum(paragraphs: 4)` - 4 paragraphs `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum(words: 100)` - 100 words `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum(words: 100, html: true)` - 100 words, paragraphs joined by `
` `LoremIpsum.lorem_ipsum(50, join: "\r\n")` - join paragraph with a custom string `LoremIpsum.short` - a short text `LoremIpsum.long` - a long text ... And many more options (check the README) ### Rails Just use "lorem_ipsum" in your views as in the examples above! ERB: `<%= text_area_tag 'placeholder', lorem_ipsum %>` HAML: `%p= lorem_ipsum(paragraphs: 5)`
